page.title: 09Recreation in Yewdale
page.content: Cumbrians are renowned for their interest in all forms of sport, and this area is no exception. The tradition of{fell-running}is carried on with annual races taking place on the adjoining Coniston Fells. Even the local secondary school has its own fell-race. Field sports, in the form of {fox-hunting}with foot-followers (too rugged for horses) are an accepted and important part of the local scene, since the fox population has to be controlled.{Fishing}for trout in the becks,{shooting}and{deer-stalking}are also to be found, but on a smaller scale. In nearby Coniston, the traditional sports of{cricket}and {football}are very strongly represented with{sailing}on Coniston Water as a further attraction.
